item.title: Choosing not to see
item.description: One of my fellow ham radio operators wryly thanked Al Gore for yesterday’s unusually code and wet weather. Setting aside climate politics for a moment, let’s look at the data. See the big blue bar centered on June? It’s typically our rainiest month. I have to remind myself of this every one of the 20 odd years we’ve lived here. Junes are rainy. Get over it. The average lows and highs are 59 deg and 78 deg, respectfully.

item.title: On the air
item.description: I’ve wanted to be an amateur radio operator since I was a little kid and read about the hobby in Boys’ Life magazine. As a high schooler, I scraped together the pennies to buy a shortwave radio receiver, a Yaesu FRG-7, and with a long wire I ran up to the roof of my parents’ house, I listened to the world. Catching the English language broadcast of Radio Tirana from Albania was a memorable highlight.
